intro: Vaccinium corymbosum var. atrococcum, commonly known as black huckleberry, is a low-growing shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that transition into edible, dark purple berries. These berries are rich in antioxidants and have a tart, slightly sweet flavor. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
